Class Seating

  • java.lang.Object
    • Seating
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bar, Booth, Oval, Table

    public class Seating
extends java.lang.Object
    This class will control the seating availability given a certain table type.
    Author:
    Craig Lombardo

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.util.ArrayList<Customer> availableSeating
      used to map available seating, if null then seat is open else there should be a customer there
      protected Restaurant myRest
      The Restaurant the table is in
      protected int numberOfSeatsAvailable
      The number of seats at a given table
      protected java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> seatingIndexes
      This keeps a tally on number of each availability type in a 2d array
      protected java.lang.String tableType
      The type of table we are looking at

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Seating()
      This constructor method instantiates the 2d array, as well as creates the RandomGaussian number generators for stay times.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkForSize(int size)
      This method checks for the availability at a given table for a specific group size.
      void checkGroupAvailability()
      This method checks the availability at the table for all group sizes.
      Customer getNextCustomerToDepart()
      This method calculates which customer group is next to leave at the table and returns them.
      int getNumberOfSeatsAvailable()
      This method gets the number of seats at a given table.
      void printSeats()
      This method provides the user with a visual representation of the available seating positions for a group.
      void removeGroup(Customer leaving)
      This method removes the group from their table, it also recalculates the availability for the table.
      boolean tryToSeatGroup(Customer group)
      This method tries to seat a group, returning a boolean representing whether or not the seating was successful.
      java.util.ArrayList<Customer> wrap(int size)
      This method wraps the arraylist for continuity at the oval, allowing for seating that is otherwise impossible at seating areas like the bar.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Seating

        public Seating()
        This constructor method instantiates the 2d array, as well as creates the RandomGaussian number generators for stay times.

    • Method Detail

      • getNumberOfSeatsAvailable

        public int getNumberOfSeatsAvailable()
        This method gets the number of seats at a given table. (Irregardless of whether or not the seats are taken)
        Returns:
        int The number of seats at the table.

      • wrap

        public java.util.ArrayList<Customer> wrap(int size)
        This method wraps the arraylist for continuity at the oval, allowing for seating that is otherwise impossible at seating areas like the bar. Tables are also given this continuitu so multiple small groups may sit at the same table, It's a great way to meet new people and adds seating options.
        Parameters:
        size - The size of the group attempted to be seated.
        Returns:
        ArrayList The corrected ArrayList that gives continuity or "circular-ness" to an otherwise linear list.

      • checkForSize

        public void checkForSize(int size)
        This method checks for the availability at a given table for a specific group size.
        Parameters:
        size - The size of the group we want to know if we have seating for.

      • checkGroupAvailability

        public void checkGroupAvailability()
        This method checks the availability at the table for all group sizes.

      • removeGroup

        public void removeGroup(Customer leaving)
        This method removes the group from their table, it also recalculates the availability for the table.
        Parameters:
        leaving - The group that is done eating and is about to get up.

      • printSeats

        public void printSeats()
        This method provides the user with a visual representation of the available seating positions for a group. Indexes are the seating position of the first person in the group.

      • getNextCustomerToDepart

        public Customer getNextCustomerToDepart()
        This method calculates which customer group is next to leave at the table and returns them.
        Returns:
        Customer The customer group that is next to leave.

      • tryToSeatGroup

        public boolean tryToSeatGroup(Customer group)
        This method tries to seat a group, returning a boolean representing whether or not the seating was successful.
        Parameters:
        group - The customers to seat.
        Returns:
        boolean A boolean representing whether or not the group was actually seated.
